snippet: Analysts, while not ruling out the possibility of the shooting of Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour because of rising tensions, said initial details were contradictory at best.
abstract: Taliban's frenzied denials of rumored death of its supreme leader, Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, reflect disunion in movement's ranks; uncertainty over leadership and factionalism within militant organization come as Afghan and Pakistani leaders again prepare for peace negotiations with group.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Rod Nordland from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: Analysts, while not ruling out the possibility of the shooting of Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour because of rising tensions, said initial details were contradictory at best.

headline.main: Conflicting Reports on Taliban Leader’s Status Highlight Fraying Unity
headline.print_headline: Conflicting Reports on Taliban Leader’s Status Highlight Group’s Fraying Unity
